Package net.xqhs.util.logging

Class BaseLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.logging.BaseLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger, LoggerClassic
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DumbLogger
    public abstract class BaseLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements LoggerClassic
    This abstract class offers an implementation for the methods specified by the LoggerClassic interface, leaving only l(net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger.Level, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) and lr(java.lang.Object) to be implemented.

    The implementation currently replicates the code in Unit and UnitExt.

    Author:
    andreiolaru

      • le

        public void le​(java.lang.String message,
               java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Outputs an error message.
        Specified by:
        le in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        message - : the message string. Apparitions of the Logger.ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.

      • lr

        public java.lang.Object lr​(java.lang.Object ret)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Outputs a fine logging message just before returning the Object in the argument.

        This method is supposed to be used in return statements, e.g. return lr(value);

        The message will contain the Object in the argument.

        Specified by:
        lr in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        ret - : the Object to return and to display.
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • ler

        public boolean ler​(boolean ret,
                   java.lang.String message,
                   java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        This method should be used in return statements for error cases. It adds an error log message just before returning the value in the first argument.
        Specified by:
        ler in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        ret - : the value to return.
        message - : the message to display. Logger.Level.ERROR will be used. Apparitions of the Logger.ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • lr

        public abstract java.lang.Object lr​(java.lang.Object ret,
                                    java.lang.String message,
                                    java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Outputs a fine logging message just before returning the Object in the argument.

        This method is supposed to be used in return statements, e.g. return lr(value, message);

        The Object in the argument is also put in the log message, in a form decided by the implementation.

        Specified by:
        lr in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        ret - : the Object to return and to display.
        message - : the message to display beside the Object. Apparitions of the Logger.ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • dbg

        public void dbg​(Debug.DebugItem debug,
                java.lang.String message,
                java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Description copied from interface: Logger
        Outputs a fine logging message only if the specified Debug.DebugItem is activated.
        Specified by:
        dbg in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        debug - : the Debug.DebugItem
        message - : the message string. Apparitions of the Logger.ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.

      • l

        protected abstract void l​(Logger.Level messageLevel,
                          java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.Object... arguments)
        This method calls the underlying logging infrastructure to display a message with the specified level, text, and parameter objects.
        Parameters:
        messageLevel - - the level of the message.
        message - - the text of the message.
        arguments - - the objects to be inserted in the placeholders of the message text (see Logger).
